runs.comm: a short one which Trescothick jabs down off his hips for a quick single to midwicket
ooh, interesting amounts of away swing already and Bell thinks about chasing that one, fishing with a straight bat, but pulls it away at the last minute
a thick outside edge gets Bell off the mark and the crowd roar their appreciation
Trescothick walks across to his off stump to jam that one down into short midwicket and they shuffle a run
a good length on off stump and that's dinked into the covers
Brilliant bouncer - a snorter which pitches short and bends away just past Bell's shoulder. Bell was completely undone there on the back foot and he got out of the way just in time
opens the face and guides that down to third man
speared right in, Bell tries to straight drive that and Trescothick has to dive back over the line at the non-striker's end as the ball cannons back to the bowler
plays that early and dinks it down in front of him, looking for the quick single
intelligent quick single, run through as the batsman just jabs his bat down on that
short-arm bunt over midwicket to bring up England's first boundary. Just a jab off the bottom third of his bat and that races across a lightning outfield. Lovely
right up in the blockhole and there are loud cries of "No!"
good slower ball at 70mph, pitched up and bounces just outside off stump and the batsman hastily defends
another quick single, dropping the ball at the feet and rushing through
typical Tresco, I'm afraid, his feet welded into the crease and he fishes at that off the back foot with no movement as the ball bends over his outside edge
short ball and Trescothick pretty much deliberately edges that one over the slip cordon and it flies away
top shot - Trescothick bothers to move his feet this time, moving backwards and lamps that through cover off the back foot. Beautiful
another slower ball but Trescothick picks it and straight-drives that back past the diving bowler. Good stuff
a cheeky single into covers, the drive not quite timed
a bit of a long hop but Trescothick's attempted tickle to fine leg fails and it's quickly scooped up. England missed out there
classical square drive through point, on the up. Just a flick of the wrists, all timing, a beautiful shot
helped off the back foot into gully
ooh, good bowling and that was nearly the end for Trescothick, whose inside edge just eluded the stumps
slower ball and helped round the corner by Trescothick, who's hitting himself back into form here. He'll be enjoying this dart
flick of a drive to mid-off
strayed down leg and that's forcefully timed off his hips, a scorcher - and four all the way
moved away off the seam and Bell pulls away from that on the back foot
defended off the back foot and an edge flies behind point
Trescothick looked to give himself room but nearly got yorked, managing to get it away to the gully region in the end, just about. Well bowled

grabbed at first slip at the second attempt. Bell stands his ground - oh no, not more controversy! - and the umpires have a chat before making a decision... which is to radio for the third umpire who doesn't hesitate in calling that out. That's an excellent catch, with a low dive to his right. Bell was looking to late cut that past the vacant second slip area but Khan was superb in hanging on to that one.
guided out to point

cleaned up first ball. Great, great ball from Asif at 85mph; perfect pitch, nipping back and taking middle stump as Pietersen swishes a would-be cover-drive and that wicket brings up huge cheers from the large Pakistan contingent. Beauty
watchfully defended first up

edged and gone! That's three wickets in five balls for Pakistan whose tails are more than up. That ball was another offcutter going across Strauss who chased it, before edging through to Akmal for a fine catch, low to his left.
jabbed into the covers and that's quickly underarmed back to the bowler
a good line but slightly too short and that's helped into midwicket
slower ball induces a horrible shot from Trescothick, reaching out to help that to a wide third man; his bottom hand flies off the bat in the process. That wasn't controlled at all
shuffles into line to play that one outside the off stump but it's too good; he misses it and it flies through to the keeper
on a good length and the batsman can only defend on the back foot
a touch of room and that's viciously cut to backward point off the back foot, but it's scooped up easily
a beauty; that pitches on a good length and moves away from Collingwood who goes fishing, misses and then nods his head in appreciation
oversteps with that one; the ball moves in off the seam and the batsman defends
Collingwood drags that right onto his stumps, unleashing his arms, safe in the knowledge that that's a free hit. The batsmen scramble through
defended
comes down the track and has a fresh-air waft, failing to connect
whipped off the hips forcefully down to fine leg
defended off the back foot. Great bowling, this
comes down the wicket and just manages to get pad on that one and it jumps to gully
onto that one early, sends it over the top and that beats mid on

gone, a soft dismissal, trying to run that down to third man. A decent delivery but that's a simple edge through to Akmal. Pakistan's bowlers are really running riot here, turning the screw on England
drops that one short and that's helped out to square leg
guides that to third man off the back foot
worked into midwicket to get Trescothick back on strike
lovely lofted drive through the vacant mid-off area flies flat and straight
good reply, a decent bouncer which Trescothick just sways away from. Akmal throws the stumps down
fairly flat leg spinner tossed up and that was rushed out to the on-side area
quicker offspinner at 62.9mph and that beat the batsman
dug out and worked into the off side
a huge appeal but Peter Hartley is quick to shout "Not out". Ooh, it w as close one, perhaps just hitting leg stump as it raps the batsman on the pad, moving onto his back foot
a beauty and that beats the batsman again
single behind backward point
pitches short and moves away from the righthander who chases that one. Good piece of bowling, that
dropped by Afridi out in the deep. Ouch, that was an easy one, driven high out to the cover boundary and Afridi should have had that; he had plenty of time to sight that one
worked into short midwicket and there's an attempted shy but the batsmen are already through
worked off the back foot but that's swept up on the cover boundary
slower ball, well watched and that's helped to midwicket. That's quickly returned and Dalrymple dives smartly back into his crease at full stretch
a one-bounce four to fine leg. Dalrymple was surprised by the bouncer but did well to hook that round and it bounces just inside the rope
worked into the covers off the back foot
whipped into the legside to the furthest boundary
smashed away through midwicket - you can take that risk against Afridi because he's not a big turner of the ball
ooh, he nicked that one off the back foot but Akmal fluffed it
tries to work that one to fine leg
single off a languid pull
worked off the back foot to mid-on
wide and that's cut to backward point but it's picked up
worked off the back foot to mid off
picked up off the hips and that bounces just in front of the fielder, Rana, at deep backward square
short and Dalrymple flashes a drive to mid-off
pulls that straight through the leg-side and the batsmen decide not to take the second run, probably wisely
Rrverse sweep tickled away. Cheeky shot, nice
leg-side wide, which Afridi questions, to no avail, of course
another reverse sweep falls forward on the on-side but it just trickles there
a reverse sweep again
a tight two from an on-drive
casual drive
gone this time and that was an excellent delivery, moving a touch away from the lefthander who sent a little nibble through to Akmal. That's an important wicket and England will now need to rebuild
short ball and that's worked off the hips behind square
easy late cut run down to third man
did well to squeeze that out on the leg side and that brings up England's 100. There are cheers but their total is so far looking too small on a small pitch
off-drive
reverse sweep to the man on the 45
rushed to fine leg
offspinner and that's late cut away
another reverse sweep
the batsman misses a chance to cut and that dot ball rounds off a decent over from Afridi
comes down the track and goes for a big whoosh but only gets a bottom edge on that and it jumps down to short midwicket
huge edge through the vacant slips area and that rushes through to third man. A good ball, that, all the same
slashed aerially into the off-side but not near a fielder

a huge appeal as the batsman twirls around, trying to pull that, and gets rapped on the right thigh. That was given as runs, so there must have been an edge, but HawkEye had the ball coming on and hitting off-and-middle
steps across to cut that off the back foot to point

slower delivery chipped into the leg-side and that's a good catch from Shoaib Akhtar, making good ground from deep mid-on running forward and taking that low, with a little roll at the end. Good stuff and England are looking deep in trouble here, although there is a glimmer in that they they know they've got a long batting line-up
forced on to the back foot to defend
dropped on a good length and that's dribbled out to cover for a tidy run
tried to work that out straight but the ball flew awkwardly off the bat square; not quite what he had intended
defended, jumping, off the back foot
driven straight down the ground but it's picked up by Afridi
slower delivery, Read waits for it and carves a neat cut to point
extra pace from Akhtar and there's a windy whoosh as the batsman creates room but the ball flies through to Akmal
short, wide and got the treatment with a deliberate flash off the back foot over the vacant slip area
pushed on to the back foot and that's driven forward
good bowling - the batsman looked to come down the track, and wide, to that but Shoaib sent the ball at his feet
overshoots that ball and Read times that low full toss off his toes between mid-off and midwicket
the batsman chases that with an attempted hook; he misses but the pair scamper a cheeky bye as the ball runs through to the keeper
a huge heave high into the air and that does straight down the throat of Rana Naved on the square leg boundary who waits for it and takes a good catch in the end
doesn't get hold of an aerial straight drive and that's just a single
rushed into the covers
Yardy beasts that one over midwicket for the first six of the innings
crashed off the back foot through the off-side for four; there was a lot of power in that shot indeed
hit high into the air and that drops between long-off and long-on and they come back for two
